segment.source: Before you deploy Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) in your environment, you should verify that you can meet the hardware and software requirements for the components you plan to deploy, according to your chosen deployment scenario.
segment.target: Before you deploy Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) in your environment, you should verify that you can meet the hardware and software requirements for the components you plan to deploy, according to your chosen deployment scenario.

segment.source: Describes the recommended hardware and software requirements for each of the Application Virtualization System components.
segment.target: Describes the recommended hardware and software requirements for each of the Application Virtualization System components.

segment.source: Application Virtualization Sequencer Hardware and Software Requirements
segment.target: Application Virtualization Sequencer Hardware and Software Requirements

segment.source: Describes the minimum recommended hardware and software configuration for your Microsoft Application Virtualization Sequencer workstation.
segment.target: Describes the minimum recommended hardware and software configuration for your Microsoft Application Virtualization Sequencer workstation.

segment.source: Application Virtualization Client Hardware and Software Requirements
segment.target: Application Virtualization Client Hardware and Software Requirements

segment.source: Describes the recommended minimum hardware and software configuration for your installation of the Application Virtualization Desktop Client and the Application Virtualization Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services).
segment.target: Describes the recommended minimum hardware and software configuration for your installation of the Application Virtualization Desktop Client and the Application Virtualization Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services).

segment.source: Configuring Prerequisite Groups in Active Directory for App-V
segment.target: Configuring Prerequisite Groups in Active Directory for App-V

segment.source: Describes the objects that you must install in Active Directory groups before you install the App-V system.
segment.target: Describes the objects that you must install in Active Directory groups before you install the App-V system.

segment.source: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 for App-V Management Servers
segment.target: How to Configure Windows Server 2008 for App-V Management Servers

segment.source: Describes how to configure the server running Windows Server 2008 by installing Internet Information Services (IIS) as a role so that you can install the App-V Management Web Service.
segment.target: Describes how to configure the server running Windows Server 2008 by installing Internet Information Services (IIS) as a role so that you can install the App-V Management Web Service.

segment.source: Application Virtualization Deployment and Upgrade Checklists
segment.target: Application Virtualization Deployment and Upgrade Checklists

segment.source: Provides checklists of tasks to guide you through the correct sequence when installing or upgrading the App-V system.
segment.target: Provides checklists of tasks to guide you through the correct sequence when installing or upgrading the App-V system.

segment.source: Application Virtualization Deployment and Upgrade Considerations
segment.target: Application Virtualization Deployment and Upgrade Considerations
